title: Full Stack Engineer
description:
About the job
Fullstack Developer / DevOps – Berlin – Up to €100,000 – (90% Remote) – 35h Week

A Berlin-based government-backed organization is looking for an experienced Fullstack Developer with DevOps capabilities to support the continuous improvement and long-term stability of public infrastructure systems that matter.

This team is responsible for mission-critical applications used across various public services, and they're seeking a technically strong, detail-oriented engineer to help modernize and secure their stack. The environment is mature, collaborative, and designed for engineers who value quality, ownership, and reliability.

What you’ll do:
Implement security patches and software updates to ensure system integrity.
Refactor and optimize legacy code for maintainability, scalability, and performance.
Troubleshoot and resolve application errors across both frontend and backend.
Integrate applications into a broader services ecosystem, ensuring compatibility and consistency.
Automate build and deployment workflows to improve delivery speed and reliability.
Review performance bottlenecks and deploy data-driven improvements.
Maintain clear technical documentation and communicate with stakeholders across teams.

Tech Environment:
Frontend: HTML, CSS, JavaScript, React, Angular
Backend: Java (Spring Boot), Python, Node.js, Ruby on Rails
DevOps: Git, Docker, Kubernetes, CI/CD pipelines
Cloud: Experience with AWS, Azure or GCP preferred
Databases: PostgreSQL, MySQL, SQL/NoSQL variants

You should bring:
Solid experience building and maintaining fullstack applications in a production environment
Strong understanding of agile workflows and modern DevOps practices
A practical mindset for automation, testing, and long-term software health
Comfortable working in both German and English-speaking teams

Why apply:
90% remote flexibility
35-hour workweek with no overtime culture
Long-term project (initial 18 months + likely extension)
Public sector purpose with private-sector engineering standards
Competitive salary (up to €100,000 annually)

This is a high-impact role with long-term prospects and excellent work-life balance. If you’re a seasoned engineer ready to take ownership of meaningful systems and prefer clean code, stable deployments, and real-world impact this is work that matters. You won’t just ship features, you’ll help define and uphold the reliability of software that people can’t afford to have fail.

This is an urgent requirement with interviews arranged at short notice. If you're looking to apply your skills to a meaningful and impactful project in a high-trust environment, we encourage you to get in touch promptly.
